radiographic_examinations.findings: Vague 4.5-cm hypodense area within the caudate lobe, may represent focal fatty infiltration. No pericardial effusion, intra- or extra-hepatic biliary dilatation. Mild atherosclerosis involving the abdominal aorta. No free fluid, free air, or lymphadenopathy in abdomen or pelvis. Left fat-containing inguinal hernia noted. Degenerative changes in the spine at the thoracolumbar level.
